item.title: Can you Read This? (Or: how I Improved Text Readability on the Web for the Visually Impaired)
item.description:
Description

Speaker:: Asya Frumkin

Track: PyData: Computer Vision I will explain my approach of detecting texts on top of an image background that are unreadable to people with visual impairment. I will explain the challenges I. encountered when using different OCR architectures for this task and talk about the solution I came up with.

Recorded at the PyConDE & PyData Berlin 2022 conference, April 11-13 2022. https://2022.pycon.de More details at the conference page: https://2022.pycon.de/program/MCLBLZ Twitter: https://twitter.com/pydataberlin Twitter: https://twitter.com/pyconde
item.dc:creator: Asya Frumkin

item.title: How Mobileye generates augmented images to boost autonomous driving
item.description:
Description

Detecting lanes and road markings are some of the great challenges autonomous driving technologies face today. In Mobileye, we do it by training neural networks. This method requires an enormous amount of data from many countries, different weather conditions etc. However, in some road scenarios the available data set is still too small, or the data is not accurate. In this session, I will discuss how we developed a system that uses Python with OpenCV to generate augmented images and matching ground truth data in order to improve accuracy of neural networks.
